There are $n$ stations on a 2D plane. Each station $i$ has coordinates $(x_i, y_i)$ and increases the timer by $a_i$ units when visited.  The player starts at station 1.

The player moves between stations at a cost of $d \cdot dist$ time units, where $dist$ is the distance traveled between stations and $d$ is a constant. The distance between stations $i$ and $j$ is calculated as $|x_i - x_j| + |y_i - y_j|$.

The player initially has a timer value between 0 and 1. At each station, the player can buy time units for 1 unit of money.

Given the coordinates of the stations and the value of $d$, find the minimum amount of money the player needs to reach station $n$.

You have a set of points on a 2D plane. Each point represents a station that increases a timer by a given amount when visited. You start at point 1 and need to reach a specific point (n).  The cost to travel between points is based on the distance between them. You can buy time at each point to increase your timer. Find the minimum amount of money needed to reach point n.
